meanings.definition: Sharing a common boundary or border.
meanings.sent1: The two houses were conterminously connected by a fence.
meanings.sent2: The countries were conterminously located next to each other.
meanings.sent3: The conterminously placed trees made it easy to distinguish the properties.
meanings.sent4: The conterminously positioned buildings seemed to merge into one.
meanings.sent5: The conterminously shared wall provided privacy for both families.

meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The conterminously scheduled events caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: The conterminously released movies made it hard to choose.
meanings.sent3: The conterminously ringing phones created a cacophony in the office.
meanings.sent4: The conterminously running clocks symbolized the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The conterminously occurring thunder and lightning startled the campers.
